content.description:
Minihaha is a lowball overhang problem that climbs good rock over an equally good landing. Don't let its looks deceive you, it climbs pretty well.

Sit start with hands spaced at the bottom of the rail on a pair of edges. From there, work out the overhand on edges, reach the jug, swing the feet on the opposite face, and top it out uses the generous features.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine. The landing is very good, but there is a rock that sits behind the problem's finish.
content.location: It climbs the northeast overhang of Doctore.

content.description:
Apotheosis climbs a slight overhang on solid edges. The problem revolves around a difficult move to an undercling.

Sit start with a left hand crimp and a right hand sidepull-edge on the arete. From there, stand up into a left hand undercling, heel the arete, reach a right hand crimp, adjust the feet, stick the bump on the lip, then crank up on top using the remaining bumps.
content.protection: A pair of pads worked well for me. The landing is shared with a rock, but it pads well, and really isn't much of an issue.
content.location: It climbs the easternmost section of Doctore's south face.
